A Syntax node represents a tree of nodes with tokens at the leaves.
Each node has accessors for its known children, and allows efficient
iteration over the children through its
property.
Checks if the current syntax node can be cast to a given specialized syntax type.
The absolute position of the starting point of this node. If the first token
is with leading trivia, the position points to the start of the leading
trivia.
Return an array of enclosing lexical contexts for the purpose of macros,
from the innermost enclosing lexical context (first in the array) to the
outermost. If this syntax node itself is a lexical context, it will be
the innermost lexical context.

if this node is the root.
